Key Match Events: New Zealand youngster Finn Allen stunned Australia's bowling attack with an incredible display of power hitting in his first World Cup innings.
Finn Allen partnered with Devon Conway at the top of the Black Caps' innings and tore apart the reigning champions' first-choice bowling attack.
Allen was eventually clean bowled by Josh Hazlewood after scoring 42 runs in a 16-ball knock.
Allen bludgeoned five fours and three sixes in his innings, with New Zealand putting on 56 for the first wicket in just 25 deliveries.
Post-Match Reflections: New Zealand great Ian Smith commented on Allen's performance, noting the freedom and mindset Allen displayed during his innings.
Smith highlighted the contrast between New Zealand's aggressive start in this match and their slower start in last year's World Cup final against Australia.
